thread.title: Yobe Intensifies Steps To Combat HIV/AIDS
thread.title_full: Yobe Intensifies Steps To Combat HIV/AIDS

author: Mohammed Abubakar
title: Yobe Intensifies Steps To Combat HIV/AIDS
text:
Yobe State is taking bold steps to combat HIV/AIDS, aiming for zero new infections across the state. Governor Mai Mala Buni assured total collaboration and commitment to this goal when he received the Zonal Director of the National Agency for the Control of HIV/AIDS, Mr. John Tobias, at Government House Damaturu today.
The Governor’s Deputy, Idi Barde Gubana, directed the health Commissioner to develop awareness campaigns involving religious leaders. These campaigns according to him will address behaviors that spread the virus and stigma, while encouraging ownership of the response.
Additionally, all health centers will provide test kits and promote laboratory testing.
This initiative aligns with Nigeria’s National HIV and AIDS Strategic Framework 2021-2025, which aims for an AIDS-free Nigeria with zero new infections and zero AIDS-related discrimination. Yobe State’s efforts are crucial in achieving this vision.
Key strategies to be adopted include Awareness Campaigns Involving religious leaders to address high-risk behaviors and stigma.
Testing and Treatment by providing test kits and encouraging laboratory testing, Community Engagement, Encouraging ownership of the response.
By working together, Yobe State can make significant progress in combating HIV/AIDS and achieving zero new infections.
